Derrek Chow is an interdisciplinary researcher and designer using software and hardware to create new forms of computers.

He is currently making art with computers at Treasure Hill Art Village in Taipei, Taiwan.

About

Derrek Chow is an interdisciplinary researcher and designer from Toronto, Canada. His work explores Human-Computer Interaction and the intersections of art, design, and technology to create new, more empowering and humane ways to interact with computers.

He is currently pursuing a Bachelor of Software Engineering at the University of Waterloo and conducting research at the Human-Computer Interaction Lab. In the past, he was a software engineering intern at startups in various industries.

Contact: hi@derrekchow.com

Links: bookshelf, music playlists, quotes


"The purpose of any tool ought to be to help human beings become more human."

Howard Rheingold on Seymour Papert, Tools for Thought
